meanings.definition: A type of Italian ice cream made with a high proportion of milk and cream, different from American ice cream in that it has a lower fat content and less air.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a scoop of gelato on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: The gelato shop offered a variety of flavors to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The gelato was so creamy and delicious, it felt like a sweet cloud in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as refreshing as a scoop of gelato on a sunny afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The gelato melted on my tongue, leaving a delightful taste behind.

meanings.definition: A frozen dessert similar to ice cream but made with a higher proportion of milk and a lower proportion of cream and eggs.
meanings.sent1: The gelato had a smoother texture compared to traditional ice cream.
meanings.sent2: We decided to have gelato instead of regular ice cream for a change.
meanings.sent3: As the gelato melted, it turned into a delicious puddle on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The gelato was a cool oasis in the desert of a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The gelato was like a frozen hug on a sweltering afternoon.
